metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3498 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The user module in ansible before 1.6.6 allows remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary commands. It was discovered that Ansible improperly handled the output of certain commands. An attacker could use this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the ansible manging host.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
ansible-fireball - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
ansible-node-fireball - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
